intro: Elatostema goudotianum var. manongarivense, commonly known as the Manongarive elatostema, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettles and related species. The plant is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant adaptation and biodiversity in Madagascar.
